Customer.name: Progress State Research and Production Center
Fifth Research Institute of MOD
Customer.longBio:
Qian Xuesen

Qian Xuesen was a prominent Chinese aerodynamicist and cyberneticist who contributed to rocket science and established engineering cybernetics and made important contributions to China's missile and space program.

Qian Xuesen's "Opinions on the Establishment of China's National Defense Aviation Industry" immediately attracted the attention of the central government. On March 14, 1956, Premier Zhou Enlai personally presided over a meeting of the Central Military Commission to study and decide that Premier Zhou Enlai, Marshal Nie Rongzhen, and Qian Xuesen would prepare to establish the leading institution for missile aviation scientific research.The committee would establish design institutions, scientific institutions, and production institutions.

Customer.name: Ministry of Aerospace Industry of China
China Aerospace Science and Technology Corporation
Engine Design Department of the Fifth Research Institute of MOD
Customer.longBio:
Zhu senyuan

Zhu is an expert in liquid rocket engines,after graduated from the Bauman Moscow State Technical University in December 1960,he was appointed as a designer of Engine Design Department of the Fifth Research Institute of MOD,completed research on the critical heat flux and supercritical heat transfer of flow boiling heat transfer in pipes. Zhu also prticipated in the development of liquid rocket engines for various short-range, medium range, and intercontinental missiles.
